big.ij.snake2D
Class Snake2DKeeper

java.lang.Object
  big.ij.snake2D.Snake2DKeeper

public class Snake2DKeeper
extends java.lang.Object

This class encapsulates the interactive and managerial aspects of snakes. It handles objects that implement the Snake2D interface.

See Also:
Snake2D

Field Detail

absoluteAccuracy

public double absoluteAccuracy
The absolute accuracy of the line minimizer. Initialized to the float machine precision. Determines convergence of the line-minimization process when the optimal parameter nears zero.

See Also:
relativeAccuracy

initialBracketingStep

public double initialBracketingStep
The size of the first step taken when attempting to bracket the minimum along a new direction. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision.

maximalParabolicBracketingExcursion

public double maximalParabolicBracketingExcursion
The size of the maximum magnification allowed for a parabolic-fit step when attempting to bracket the minimum along a new direction. Initialized to the inverse of the square root of the float machine precision.

nonQuadraticBracketingDegeneracy

public double nonQuadraticBracketingDegeneracy
Determines when parabolic bracketing must be abondonned in favor of arbitrary extrapolation. Initialized to the float machine precision.

numericalGradientStepSize

public double numericalGradientStepSize
The size of the steps taken when computing a numerical approximation of the gradient by a finite-difference mechanism. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision. Mathematically, one component g of the gradient is computed as g(x) = ½ g(x + Δx) - g(x - Δx) ⁄ Δx, where Δx is the quantity given by numericalGradientStepSize.

relativeAccuracy

public double relativeAccuracy
The relative accuracy of the line minimizer. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision.

See Also:
absoluteAccuracy

vanishingGradientConvergence

public double vanishingGradientConvergence
Determines convergence by virtue of a vanishing norm of the gradient. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision.

vanishingStepConvergence

public double vanishingStepConvergence
Determines convergence by virtue of a vanishing line-minimization relative step. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision.

vanishingTotalDisplacementConvergence

public double vanishingTotalDisplacementConvergence
Determines convergence by virtue of a globally vanishing global update of the parameters after cycling through all its components. Initialized to the square root of the float machine precision.

Constructor Detail

Snake2DKeeper

public Snake2DKeeper()
Method Detail

interact

public void interact(Snake2D snake,
                     ij.ImagePlus display)
This method overlays handles on the image and lets the user interact with them. It calls the method Snake2D.getNodes() one times to initialize the snake-defining nodes, and calls the method Snake2D.setNodes() repeatedly to update the snake-defining nodes during the interactive session. The skin of the snake is drawn according to the data available through the method Snake2D.getScales(). It is possible to request that the interaction be aborted by letting the method Snake2D.isAlive() return false. This request will be honored at the next user attempt to modify the snake.

Parameters:
display - A mandatory ImagePlus object over which the handles used to interactively manipulate the snake will be overlaid.
See Also:
Snake2D.isAlive(), Snake2D.getNodes(), Snake2D.setNodes(big.ij.snake2D.Snake2DNode[]), Snake2D.getScales()

interactAndOptimize

public void interactAndOptimize(Snake2D snake,
                                ij.ImagePlus display)
This method combines the methods interact() and optimize(). It allows the user to alternate between interactive guiding of the snake and automatic optimization under control of the class Snake2DKeeper.

Parameters:
display - A mandatory ImagePlus object over which the handles used to interactively manipulate the snake will be overlaid. The skin used to represent the snake will be overlaid on the same image.
See Also:
interact(big.ij.snake2D.Snake2D, ij.ImagePlus), optimize(big.ij.snake2D.Snake2D, ij.ImagePlus)

optimize

public void optimize(Snake2D snake,
                     ij.ImagePlus display)
This method performs the optimization of the snake according to the measure implemented in the method Snake2D.energy(). It relies on the method Snake2D.getEnergyGradient() to compute the gradient of this energy. The optimization proceeds by refining the initial snake returned by the method Snake2D.getNodes(), which is called once.

Parameters:
display - An ImagePlus object over which the skin used to represent the snake will be overlaid. Set this parameter to null to bypass this interactive feedback.
See Also:
Snake2D.isAlive(), Snake2D.getNodes(), Snake2D.energy(), Snake2D.getEnergyGradient()
